--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, bja@s... wrote:
> The code comes here !

Thank you!

I have successfully started Heritrix from my app, 
but there is still something i don't understand:

With the web interface, everything wors fine. But when i try to run a
crawl job from my app, Heritrix seems to be unable to make DNS
lookups.

My order.xml file was generated and tested using the web interface.

When i put an URL ("http://www.free.fr" ) in my seeds.txt file,
heritrix seems to hang while trying to make that URL's DNS lookup.

If i replace the URL with an IP address ( "http://213.228.0.42" ) here
is what happens:

5 janv. 2005 15:46:41 org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController
requestCrawlStart
INFO: Starting crawl.
5 janv. 2005 15:46:41 org.archive.crawler.url.Canonicalizer canonicalize
INFO: http://213.228.0.42/robots.txt => http://213.228.0.42/robots.txt
5 janv. 2005 15:46:41 org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP innerProcess
INFO: GET http://213.228.0.42/robots.txt 404 0 text/html
5 janv. 2005 15:46:43 org.archive.crawler.fetcher.FetchHTTP
innerProcess
INFO: GET http://213.228.0.42/ 200 0 text/html
<WARN  2005-01-05 15:46:43,515 WebIndexer::main:131> Crawler is still
running....
5 janv. 2005 15:46:44 org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController
beginCrawlStop
INFO: Starting beginCrawlStop()...
<WARN  2005-01-05 15:46:44,187 WebIndexer::crawlEnding:156>
CrawlStatusListener received a crawlEnding message, with this string:
"Finished"
5 janv. 2005 15:46:44 org.archive.crawler.framework.CrawlController
beginCrawlStop
INFO: Finished beginCrawlStop() 

I ran the same tests using my LAN's web server as a seed URL, with the
same results. 
When I use the MirrorWriterProcessor, the mirror directory isn't even
created.
When I use my own Processor (a very simple processor, which just
displays the CrawlURIs received) i can see that two URIs are
processed: robots.txt, and index.html. After that, Heritrix stops
normally. It does not follow any of my web server's index page.

I'm sure i have made a very obvious mistake, but... I can't find it
:-(
